Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: michaelp_clarke
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Check in was simple and the member of staff friendly. Car Parking: As we had arrived by car we were informed that since it was Easter street parking would be free until 9.00am on the Tuesday. The hotel has no private parking. Parking turned out to be 2.5km away at the Olympic Stadium. The up side was parking was â‚¬8 for 24 hours plus a return tram ticket for each person in the car, there was still a 500m or so walk to the hotel at the end of the tram ride OK no big deal in the way of a walk but a nuisance. If you stay in Amsterdam it would be best not to take a car. If you want to see the bulb fields and the Keukenhoff Gardens by car then think about near by Haarlem. There is a tram stop just outside the hotel will take you to the city centre, just buy your ticket on the tram. Room: A little small but very clean and well looked after. The room had a TV, twin beds, a safe and a mini fridge but no tea / coffee making facilities â€“ for that you had to go down to the lounge/breakfast room. The shower was over the bath which while it worked well is something I dislike because of all the climbing in and out but again the room was very clean. The bedroom had a small â€œbalconyâ€� shared with another room that provided a view over the back gardens of the surrounding buildings. Somewhere to go to check the weather but little else, it didn't even provide much light to the room. Food: Self-service breakfast which was OK but nothing special, choice of cereals, cold meat, fruit (some fresh some tinned). The hot food was scrambled egg â€“ a little over done, beans, and sausages etc't., didn't try them so can't comment on the quality. Various breads were available along with croissants. The toaster was of the light domestic variety and took too so long to do anything I was loosing the will to live and settled for scrambled eggs on warm bread. Orange juice from a machine, coffee from a machine, which was very good... what does it say about the place if everyone talks about how good the coffee machine was? The breakfast room itself was clean but a bit too utilitarian for 4 stars. Want and evening meal? Not available. For anything other than breakfast or snacks you have to leave the hotel (this is 4 star remember). Fortunately the street has many good restaurants to choose from but on a wet night with the temperature at 5C it would have been nice to have the choice to eat in the hotel. Checkout was as easy as checking in but I was a bit miffed having to lug the cases into the car while two members of the staff stood smoking. Perhaps I was expecting too much from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghTimbergirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during Febuary when the weather was very cold,we booked through Venere,whom still on their website promote this hotel as offering "free drinks in the lounge" we have stayed with this hotel a couple of years ago when they offered an all inclusive package,so when i saw the price on Venere for our dates i jumped at it,what a dissapointment when we arrived,the hotel has been taken over and no longer offer all inclusive and asked if we wanted to buy breakfast,again we thought this was included,i wasnt happy to say the least,we didnt purchase breakfast as it was overpriced. The hotel itself is in a quiet area about 20 min tam ride from Dam Sq,so best to buy travel pass,there isnt much open at night in this area so had to travel back into city,the rooms are clean and the beds are so comfy,electronic type,dvd player in room,nice bathroom,didnt think much of the staff,not happy looking or friendly,i wont be staying here again. I did email Venere to complain but no answer back, we actually ended up having one of the best trips we've had in this amazing city,but cost us a lot more than originaly thought,next visit in June

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable hotel close to RAI Exhibition center”
Reviews.Author: Flatulus
Reviews.Content: The Savoy Hotel is close to the RAI Exhibition center at a comfortable 10 minutes walk. There is free Wifi in the hotel, a good and plentiful breakfast, comfortable rooms with very good beds. Staff is helpful, efficient check-in and -out. Parking close to the hotel is possible. The center of Amsterdam is easily reached by tram. A pity there is no bar for a quiet drink!

Reviews.Title: “Customer is not the king”
Reviews.Author: tiiterr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night this week. Most important terms for me were presented: not too far from city center, English breakfast and free wifi internet in rooms. The first contact was nice: pretty Indonesian lady in reception was very friendly. I checked-in at 6 p.m. and on the same time a male person came to work to front desk. I saw coffee machine in breakfast room and asked from female person, how much I have to pay for coffee. She said that coffee is free of charge. On the same time guy from reception added that I have to drink coffee in the same room and I can not take the cup to my room... Strange, but OK. I entered into my room on the 3rd floor and it was very cold. The reason was a window, which was not closed. I tried to close it, but it was quit tricky, because the mechanism was broken. Somehow I was successful and thanks to air conditioner in a hour my room was more-less warm. As I had to prepare some documents, I tried connect my laptop by wifi to internet, but the signal was too weak for it. The same result with iPad. I called to reception and described the problem. Guy from front desk was very unfriendly and he suggested to take my computer with me to lobby because there the signal is stronger. I did not like this solution and asked to change my room. The answer was negative. Arguments were that there is only 5 free rooms in hotel and maybe crowd of people from street will enter and want book all these rooms. And... he has to send a cleaner to my room, if I will leave it! I explained, that there is no need for cleaner, cause I just arrived and everything is clean. Result: nothing! First time in my life hotel was not changing my room when I asked that. At morning I had breakfast with my colleague and it was really good and tasty. But... during the one hour in breakfast room we did not see any other hotel guests. So it was really hard to believe the argument of the front desk guy, that hotel was almost full.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay At The Savoy Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Iceman_1983
Reviews.Content: First of all please let me start by saying this hotel is way under rated on trip advisor. I stayed at this hotel from 24th December 2011 till 28th December 2011 with my wife and we had an amazing stay. Before leaving for Amsterdam I must have spent more than 100 hours on reading reviews and looking at different sites for hotels and was worried about the ratings but after the stay I can definitely say that this hotel which has a rating of 7.0 is way below for what you get for the price. It is like 15 mins drive from the airport. We took the connexxion shuttle which was 50 euros return trip for 2. For the hotel we paid Euro 367.00 including breakfast (which was decent compared to the 15 Euros/Person the rest of the hotels charge) and city tax of 5%. Tram 25 and 12 takes you to Dam Square and the tram station and is a stone throw away from the hotel. It is in a very nice and peaceful area with the police station next to it. Everyone at the reception was amazingly helpful and friendly. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. Lots of places to eat around inlcuding indonesian, thai etc. Places like Heinkein experience and Albert Market are like 2 stops by tram. Other places like van goh and rij museum are 2 mins away by tram. It is a non smoking hotel but u can smell the weed and in the hallway which as a smoker i definitely did not mind ;) . Overall very nice hotel for the price you pay. I would recommend it to anyone going to Amsterdam. I really don't think you wold get anything better for the price this hotel charges. P.S : If you stay here then I will advise you to get the I AM AMSTERDAM CARD...for the duration that suits you since you will use the trams a lot and get free entry to a lot of museums and a free canal cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: scruffyduncan
Reviews.Content: I only really slept at this hotel as I was in Amsterdam visiting friends. The front desk lady was polite and helpful; the room was clean, quiet and comfortable and the price was competetive for Amsterdam. It's not a luxury hotel by any stretch but it does the job. The location is not that central, but the local area is fun and pleasant with easy tram connections to other paets of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business”
Reviews.Author: mm83si
Reviews.Content: A bit outdated furniture and not really a 4* hotel, but clean and with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it and definetely ill be back”
Reviews.Author: melihyavuz
Reviews.Content: i stayed two days in this hotel . it was very clean also people who working in the hotel they were so friendly and smiley also very secure hotel . next to the police station. 30 minutes walking distance from central station . breakfast was expensive it was 15 euro but you can eat out much cheaper than this price .tea and coffee are free .

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomad2007
Reviews.Content: Resembled a Travelodge in the UK but hotel was clean and comfortable and everything worked. On street parking is very expensive and next time we will use buses or trams (or rent bicycles) as public transport is plentiful and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: clairewise
Reviews.Content: Positives first: interesting modern decor, updated furnishings (i.e. flat screen tv), free wireless, quiet location away from the busy center, but not too far to walk, not expensive compared to other hotels. Negatives: Had 2 rooms with family, 1 room smelled horribly of mildew and pets and could not be used, staff changed the room, but to a much smaller one, unfortunately. The minibar/fridge in 1 room did not work, the sink kept clogging and the air conditioning barely worked. The directions on the website for how to take the tram are not correct. There is a lot of construction on the road outside the hotel. Biggest problem: We were told upon check-in that if we needed to reach the front desk we should dial 9* on our phone. We tried this in both rooms, and it did not work--neither did the button on the phone for "Reception". Upon check-out we were told that since we made phone calls (i.e. the attempted calls to the front desk) we had to pay for them. We had to argue with 2 different employees in order to not pay for the calls. Quite disappointing "customer service".

Reviews.Title: “living nearby”
Reviews.Author: GreenZebra
Reviews.Content: We are living a few blocks away from this hotel and I pass it everyday on my way to work. I always thought it was such a nice place for somebody visiting the city! First of all is in one of the safest areas in Amsterdam: just next to it is a police station, and it is generally in a very well-of area.Then it is close to everything: the street market, the city center, the parks, the museums, the supermarket. I haven't ever stayed in, but being often a tourist myself - judging by the area and how well taken care of it looks, i would recommend it to anybody visiting amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A disgusting hovel”
Reviews.Author: MisterB49
Reviews.Content: How they have the audacity to class this place as a 4 star hotel is beyond me. I was ushered to a room in the basement, with 2 small wiindows at pavement level. The room smelt, the phone and TV didnt work, and the walls were so thin, I had the misfortune to be kept awake by an over amorous couple in the room next door. Breakfast was forgettable. I was booked to stay for 2 nights. I checked out first thing after one night only. If this is Dutch 4 star, I pity anyone staying at a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Cowell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street about 10 minutes by tram (stop for 2 routes directly outside hotel) from the main shopping centre of Amsterdam. You can however still walk to local shopping areas and bars/restaurants. Check in was easy, and we arrived a good while before official check in time but that was not an issue. The actual room was stylish and modern (as was rest of hotel) . It had a decent flat screen TV (with local channels and for UK visitors BBC1 and BBC2), good bathroom and the beds had an electrically powered adjustable mattress. The free hotel Wifi worked throughout the hotel and was pretty fast. Breakfast was good with a decent selection of hot and cold food. The breakfast room also doubled up as a lounge the rest of the day, with a decent self service coffee machine with a small selection of biscuits and cakes also available (coffee and cakes were complimentary).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ashlilazarus Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an easily accessible place. I took my boyfriend to amsterdam for his birthday with the idea of viewing the museums, shows and dam square. The tram that goes straight into dam square goes from just outside the hotel but the walk is only 20 minutes or so. The room was lovely. The beds were two single beds pushed together, however each bed had a seperate control for rasing the torso part so we didnt mind too much. There was also a plasma television in the room that was free to use with many english channels available. Breakfast was included. The only negative part of our stay was that on arrival a debited transaction of Â£100 is taken as an insurance/for minibar costs etc and is not released back into your account for up to 3 weeks. This wasn't something i was aware of as we were meant to be staying in the conscious hotel in museum square but at the last minute we were moved as they were 'unable to accomodate us'. Other than the one negative, the stay was generally very enjoyable and i would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its edge now”
Reviews.Author: charmermrk
Reviews.Content: I stayed a year or two back and was impressed. Nicely designed bedrooms, free drinks and snacks, location that's off the tourist trail in a nice part of town. But this time it felt ordinary - like any small chain hotel, and its weaknesses seemed more apparent. My room was pretty grubby on check-in. Freshly trod-in chewing gum on the carpet, fingerprint smears all over the window (shame as the view of the church was great). I complained about that on first night but it took two days and a reminder before anything improved. The guests seemed to be a pretty generic tourist crowd - the place just didn't have any buzz. Compared to, say, the Hotel Mozaic in The Hague, which I've used a fair amount recently and is lovely (and cheaper), the Savoy just didn't feel special. The public areas are part of the problem - there's no light. So it's all a bit dispiriting. Some redesign of the ground floor might be an idea, even if it means losing a few ground floor bedrooms, to open the space up. Free internet is always always appreciated, but it was of the erratic / infuriating variety, dropping in and out. Sharpening up of housekeeping would do wonders, and adding a bit of pizazz to the decor, marketing and promo would make a difference as well. Given it's in the Pijp, and at a time when you've got good-value hotels like Citizen M popping up in the city, the Savoy could compete much more on style if it put its mind to it. For now I fear it will decline towards ordinariness. Which is a shame. I would have recommended before. But not after this visit. It's not bad, but it's just not really special enough to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cameronhotelman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. The free drinks and snacks are a nice touch. rooms are comfortable and modern, although, like others, found windows and air con a problem. Breakfast was very poor, with very little food and most of the machines broken- service let us down here. A little way out of town, in a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient hotel but manager needs course in customer relationships”
Reviews.Author: Heinzal
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the good things that have been said of this hotel. It is only a 15 minute walk from the RAI rail station which is a direct link with the airport cost about 3 euro. A 15 minute walk in the oposite direction takes you to the museum area and canal bus link. Lots of good restaaurants in the area. The hotel is small but the rooms have been well planned with bath/shower, lcd tv, video, beds that can be raised with remote. The free mini bar is daily filled with beers and soft drinks (and wine on the first day). Some bottles of spirits are kept in the lobby and sometimes the odd cake left in the small breakfast room. There is also a free tea and coffee machine in the breakfast room. The fruit juice machine was usualy empty by 4pm and not refilled. My one gripe about the room is that because the windows are designed not to open you are reliant on the efficiency of the a/c unit on our third night it stopped working and the room soon became sauna like.The few staff we came across in the hotel seemed friendly enough other than the manager a midde aged asian guy who needs sending on a customer relartionship course. His arrogance, lack of politness and preference to take phone calls in the middle of checking out his customers means we probably wont return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “**** hotel? Yeah - it was ****”
Reviews.Author: jackflashuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a let down. The staff were on the verge of rudeness all the time. From the outside the Savoy sign is dirty. All inclusive means nothing. The fridges kept the drink barely cold. The breakfast was ****, didnt look edible. I could see into the kitchen during breakfast and the staff were in jeans and trainers. The only decent thing here is the coffee machine. The room was small, I kept banging into everything. The fixtures and fittings are ****. the service is ****, the room is ****, the all inclusive part is ****. Basically it is ****. The bed was comfy, but small, so ****. I hated this hotel from start to finish. Its located outside the centre, but thats ok if you have a bike. I dont recommend staying here, unless a short stay on business, or where you will be outside the room/hotel a lot. Its expensive for a room over your head, stay away. Awful, Awful place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust5650
Reviews.Content: I have had the good fortune to be able to travel extensively with my family (husband and 2 daughters, ages 20 and 18). We have stayed in many hotels in our travels, good and bad. We all loved this hotel. The hotel is clean, with comfortable rooms, complimentary mini bar, snacks and cocktails in the lobby, delicious hot breakfast, and a wonderful helpful staff. Our room had a window to the street with amazing blackout curtains that allowed us a fabulous night's sleep after our transatlantic flight. The beds were comfortable and EVERYTHING was clean! If in Amsterdam, stay here! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Sininen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Savoy for four nights in July and had a really nice and pleasant stay. I had been in Amsterdam only for one afternoon before this holiday so I did not really know the city and therefore spent a lot of time choosing the hotel. Wanted to have a bit of luxury but for a decent price. Good location was important so that we could visit all the sights either by public transportation or walking. Ended up booking the Savoy from the hotel's website - partly because of a special offer. Was definately a top choice and would stay there again. Small hotel with friendly staff, everything clean and tidy, good quality breakfast, free internet in the lobby. Big plus was the free minibar in the room with soft drinks, wine and beer. It was so nice when coming back to the hotel after a hot day you could have a cold drink in your room without having to think how much it will cost. Hotel is in a residential area, not in the city center but museums and other sights we visited were within 10-15 minutes tram ride. Tram stop just outside the hotel. On the same street there were several nice casual restaurants where locals spend there evenings, also places like Subway and Ben&Jerry. For us the location was perfect, we felt like we were staying in the real Amsterdam and not in some tourist spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: David1101
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying here. Especially the location. The area is very nice, lots to see and do with in walking distance. Tram stops directly across the street so getting to center and "tourist areas" very easy. You can spend days just in the neighborhood with shops, parks the largest outdoor market in A'dam. The rooms are small but the extras at the hotel are a real plus. Breakfast is good and the snacks and complementary drinks are so right for travelers just getting over the time change. I woke at 3 in the morning - wide awake. Thank goodness there was water, juice, wine and snacks to enjoy unitl the dawn. Staff was excellent. I enjoyed my time there.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what a wonderful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: danielakorem
Reviews.Content: Big, modern rooms & baths, walking distance to the market and the main museums, free coffee and cakes, free internet - definitely well worth the money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable stay in Amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: Angeladee11
Reviews.Content: I booked the Savoy at the last minute and was unsure what to expect because the price was so reasonable. I was pleasantly surprise! The staff were very helpful and friendly. Just loved coming back to my room, the bed was extremely comfortable, the room modern, flat screen TV, great bathroom, bath robe and slippers were provided. And best of all the mini bar was compilmentary. Although not much to look at from the outside, this hotel was all class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandJBelfast
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. I agree with the majority of reviews previously posted. Staff could not have been more helpful. Free bar / tea/ coffee a real plus. Plenty of restaurants / supermarkets nearby. Walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - many things included in price - near RAI”
Reviews.Author: JustAnotherVoice
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and a great find. They claim 4 stars which I can believe. It is a small European-style hotel with a single person at the front desk and a meal room (breakfast and always-available coffee etc). The rates are very competitive for the area and the value. Even budget travelers might find that the freebies may make it affordable. The price is all-inclusive which is a real treat and worth keeping in mind if you are counting your Euros. Includes a great buffet breakfast, wireless internet, free daily stock of beverages (soft drinks, water, beer, wine) in room mini-bar, minor printing at computer in lobby, free finger-food, coffee/tea/snacks in the meal room. No charge for local phone call. The people are very friendly. Location: It is very conveniently located for people who want to walk (5 to 10 minutes) to the RAI convention centre. There is a tram stop (two tram routes, no. 25 goes to Centraal) just outside. (Call) Taxi to Schipol is about 33 Euros. There is a food supermarket within a minute's walk. The rooms are compact (by 4-star standards), but very well designed, make great use of space, are comfortable, and have everything you would want. Quite refined but not the 5-star poshness which you would not miss. A single-only room (great price) was a little too small and a double room was fine and still much lower rate than many nearby hotels. The web site is hard to find with many hotel broker sites. Search for "EMB Savoy". As Nothing negative about this place unless you want a 5-star with room service. PS: I read something about sheets in earlier reviews. Whatever it is must have been resolved.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: slugbreff
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The rooms were not enormous, but they were well thought out and clean. The shower was fab! The whole place was well decorated and cared for. Breakfast was great - even for a vegetarian :-) Location was good with trams outside going into central Amsterdam every 15 mins and restaurants and museums within walking distance. Best thing is it is an island of non-smoking in Amsterdam which was a relief. When we had a problem it was sorted out immediately to our satisfaction. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Would certainly go back there. . . .

Reviews.Title: “New Year with a bang!”
Reviews.Author: Lou&Wilf
Reviews.Content: Well, we were booked to stay at the Hotel Avenue, when we arrived they asked the dreaded question, 'Didn't you get your email? !!!!! Nightmare, rooms had flooded and they were moving us to there sister hotel , Savoy! They paid for the tasi there and 48Hrs tram tickets for all the group. When we got there we couldnt believe are luck, it was very modern. Rooms were very clean and modern but really quite small but if you are only sleeping there who cares! We had a DVD player, a big plasma and electric beds that went up and down!! Also, to our surprise the rate included breakfast, anything from the mini bar plus you helped yourself to drinks in the lobby which was very nice in front of a lovely log fire!! Only thing was its location really, we had booked to stay really close to Dam square but eneded up a good 30mins walk away or a few tram rides. It didnt spoil are trip and the staff in the both hotels were very helpful and polite. Overall, it depends on what you want, its not the cheapest but it is a lovely hotel, I just wouldn't really rate the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: FrequenttravellerDE
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem. Recently renovated, situated in a nice downtown location close to the RAI exhibition centre (and not too far from the city centre - just a 15 minute tram ride) this so-called boutique hotel offers many astounding features like an extended breakfast (complete with mozzarella, tomatoes and basil, capuccino and espresso etc), nice beds you can adjust and free drinks and canapes. Even the drinks in the room are free. There is no more issue with the bed sheets but you need to ask for a key to open the windows but that is ok. If you ask for a quiet room you would be surprised how quiet the back streets of Amsterdam can be! Rooms are not large but nicely decorated and the restaurants in the area are good with a great choice. I really enjoyed it and will definitely come back - and it takes quite a bit to convince me so this was one of the most pleasant surprises among recent hotel stays!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Bananasaboutravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was recommended by conference organizers. It is close the RAI (so convenient for this) but not to most the interesting sights of Amsterdam so you have to take a tram or enjoy walking - which we did a lot of! We were initially given a room on the first floor which had quite a lot of street noise so we asked to be moved to a non-street facing room. As there were none available we were given a room on the top floor which was quieter. The room was small and based on the furnishings and facilities I would definitely say this was a three star hotel (not 4 star as we had been told). The staff were a bit surly too. For the price, I would not stay here again. It was expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Very Natural”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The second leg of our European Honeymoon Tour took us to Amsterdam. We stayed at the Hamshire Inn Prinsingratch (Don't know the exact spelling). This hotel was on the canal and was quite cozy. The location is just blocks from major attractions and we were able to walk everywhere. The front desk staff (Roger) were very nice and eager to assist with directions. The original room we booked was very small and we couldn't fit our luggage in the room. We were offered a larger room for a small fee and we jumped at it. Our room overlooked a beautiful courtyard. The only draw-back to the Hampshire is that there is no air-conditioning. The temperatures were mild even for the middle of July and the large windows provided an adequate breeze.

Reviews.Title: “No windows......”
Reviews.Author: irelandmum
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place apart from the room being too hot... when we asked why we couldn't open the windows it was to do with the police who said because of a suicide in a hotel that the windows were to be locked !! A bit strange when you think that there are safety latches available where the window could be opened a bit at least. I could not sleep as it was very hot even in April. I would not put it at 4 star as the rooms were very small and there was no dinner menu available..... but for a nice quiet location not bad and the local pub around to your left was a lovely friendly place where we felt very welcomed indeed....

Reviews.Title: “Not a walker!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah38d
Reviews.Content: Well me&my bf stayed at this hotel from the 17th for 3nights, the first day we experienced 4 of there rooms! The first two were single rooms!(not wot you want when ur planning a wkend in amsterdam!) then they finally managed to find a double smoking room - but it stunk of sewage!!We put our bags down&thought mayb a cleaner had gone to the toilet so we went to the city centre, which is a lot further than is stated! it tooks us about 20-30mins to walk to the centre of amsterdam and about 10-15mins by tram from the hotel to Centraal Station! So the location is a nightmare!We go back to the hotel&the room sunk even worse so again we got moved this time to a room with 4 single beds!!! And no smoking! The next day they finally managed to find a double, smoking, non smelly room!! The hotel is ver basic&the breakfast is really not worth rushing up for! I would certainly not be coming back to this hotel again! Somewhere much closer to the city!! It states that its a 4star! i would barly say 3*!! But other than the hotel the stay was excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “sheets are ok now”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Savoy hotel during the IBC. Hotel was great. 5 minutes walk from the RAI conference hall and by streetcar 10 minutes from the dam square. I had no problems with the sheets. The manager told me that they changed them after the trip advisor revieuws. Airco worked ok. reception desk was very helpfull. Next time in Amsterdam I will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good... but sort out the bed sheets!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hampshire from 4th-8th August 2005. We chose this paricular hotel mainly because of the price. It is very good value for money, a lot of the other hotels in Amsterdam can be very expensive. Its only a 10 minute journey on the number 25 tram from Dam square (approx 8 or 9 stops) and the trams run about every 10 minutes, the last one being at midnight. The guy on the reception at night is really nice too... he had no problem opening the bar for us when we rolled in at 1:30am!!! The only down side is the bloody bed sheets!!! On reading past reviews, I noticed that this had been mentioned before and it really is rather annoying.... Why can't they just buy some bigger bed sheets??? Having said this though, I wouldn't let this put you off staying there. As I said before, Amsterdam can be quite pricey with regards to accomodation and this hotel definately offers good value for money. PS - I love Amsterdam - its a fabulous funky place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but could do better”
Reviews.Author: JamesADB
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews hat this hotel has a lot of positives, it's obviously fairly new, nicely furnished, helpful staff and it is located in the Pijp, for me one of the best parts of Amsterdam together with the Jordaan. It's a short 10minute tram journey to the traditional tourist areas of Dam Square and the RLD but only a 2 minute walk into an area very popular with twenty and thirty-something locals and packed with excellent restaurants and bars/cafes. Everyone is extremely friendly towards tourists as they tend to be fewer in number and not of the 'lads-on-tour' variety. On the other hand, the hotel could benefit a great deal from some minor adjustments. I'm pretty thick skinned having stayed in some questionable places whislt travelling etc but I find it pretty grotty waking up in the middle of the night to find your face directly on the mattress because the bed-sheet is too small for the bed and there is no mattress-protector, goodness knows whose face was last there. My wife actually had to take anti-histamine tablets for a rash she woke up with having virtually discarded the bed-sheet during the night. Also, I prefer a double room to be a double room, not a twin, especially on a romantic weekend away! Finally the air-con clicks continually when it reaches the correct temperature, this woke us up both nights so we had to get up to switch it off, you can't open the windows so in summer it's too hot for comfort. It would cost very little to make the necessary improvements that would secure this as a first choice alternative to the more expensive central hotels. If they did this I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellant location and a very helpful and friendly staff. I would recomennd to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: amcoo23
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a lot cheaper than hotels in the city centre, it turned out to be very decent. The decor was nice enough, we even got a proper double bed (not two singles pushed together), but I agree about the comforter and sheet thing - would have been nice to have some real bedding! Getting to Centre of town was really easy and only cost 1.60 each way, took about 10 minutes to get there on the tram. I'd recommend it for those who don't want to spend too much on accommodation and don't mind the travelling to and from town.

Reviews.Title: “Okay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and paid 75 Euros per night for a double room. It was okay, I don't really regret staying there, but I'd look around for something else first next time. The hotel is brand new so everything was pretty spotless and nice. The room was comfortable and the bathroom very nice -- big bathtub! But, the negatives started to get annoying. The double bed was actually two twins pushed together. It was either sleeping 50s style (goodnight honey) or slipping down into the crack between the beds during the night. The bare mattress was covered with just a flat sheet and a comforter on top -- okay, I've seen that before here in Europe but it's pretty disgusting. You move around a little bit and discover the sheet is on the floor and you're lying naked right on the mattress. And your *** is probably not the first the mattress has met. There were a few other minor inconveniences, but otherwise the hotel is nice, comfortable, and enjoyable. The BIG negative though is that this is not in the center of town. There are a few restaurants and shops in this area, but if you want to go down to the REAL center, it's 15 minutes on the tram or bike. Right now, the street that leads to the center resembles war-torn Beirut -- in the midst of construction, so you have to detour around it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Savoy Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Ferdinand Bolstraat 194, Amsterdam 1072 LW, The Netherlands
